bible.derived: From the original Hebrew, Aramaic, and Greek, with influence from the French La Bible de JÃ©rusalem.

translations.name: New Jerusalem Bible
translations.description: The New Jerusalem Bible is an English-language translation of the Bible approved for use in study and personal devotion by the Roman Catholic Church. It was published in 1985 and edited by the Reverend Henry Wansbrough. There is a commonly held belief that the New Jerusalem Bible is not a translation of Greek and Hebrew Scriptures but rather an English version of the French Bible de Jérusalem. It is, instead, an original translation heavily influenced by the French.
